subtitleNullable: Forecast the Traffic Flow using Time Series and Graph Connections
descriptionNullable:
This dataset originated from [UCI Traffic Flow Forecasting Data Set](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Traffic+Flow+Forecasting#). The original file is in matlab format and I have changed it into csv file in [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/jvthunder/urban-traffic-time-series-forecasting). 

There is 3 files:
- train.csv (Contains 1261 timesteps for 36 locations calculated with 15 minutes intervals)
- test.csv (Contains 840 timesteps for 36 locations calculated with 15 minutes intervals)
- adj_matrix.csv (Contains the location's adjacency matrix, so you can include graph connectivity features)

The features in the train.csv are:
- timestep (the timestep of data)
- location (the location of data)
- traffic (the traffic rate at the point of time (from 0 to 1))
- prev_i (the i-th previous traffic rate)
- hour_i (one hot encoding of the current hour)
- feata_i, featb_i, featc_i (these columns I am not sure of, but the sum values suggests they are one hot encodings (only 0 or 1 values) of a certain value, you can include or not include this for your predictions)


One of the tasks you can do with this dataset is to predict the `traffic` columns.
title: Urban Traffic Flow CSV
subtitle: Forecast the Traffic Flow using Time Series and Graph Connections
description:
This dataset originated from [UCI Traffic Flow Forecasting Data Set](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Traffic+Flow+Forecasting#). The original file is in matlab format and I have changed it into csv file in [this notebook](https://www.kaggle.com/jvthunder/urban-traffic-time-series-forecasting). 

There is 3 files:
- train.csv (Contains 1261 timesteps for 36 locations calculated with 15 minutes intervals)
- test.csv (Contains 840 timesteps for 36 locations calculated with 15 minutes intervals)
- adj_matrix.csv (Contains the location's adjacency matrix, so you can include graph connectivity features)

The features in the train.csv are:
- timestep (the timestep of data)
- location (the location of data)
- traffic (the traffic rate at the point of time (from 0 to 1))
- prev_i (the i-th previous traffic rate)
- hour_i (one hot encoding of the current hour)
- feata_i, featb_i, featc_i (these columns I am not sure of, but the sum values suggests they are one hot encodings (only 0 or 1 values) of a certain value, you can include or not include this for your predictions)


One of the tasks you can do with this dataset is to predict the `traffic` columns.
